title: Job 14:1
text: MAN that is born of a woman is of few days, and full of trouble.

title: Job 14:2
text: He cometh forth like a flower, and is cut down: he fleeth also as a shadow, and continueth not.

title: Job 14:3
text: And dost thou open thine eyes upon such an one, and bringest me into judgment with thee?

title: Job 14:4
text: Who can bring a clean thing out of an unclean?  not one.

title: Job 14:5
text: Seeing his days are determined, the number of his months are with thee, thou hast appointed his bounds that he cannot pass;

title: Job 14:6
text: Turn from him, that he may rest, till he shall accomplish, as an hireling, his day.

title: Job 14:7
text: For there is hope of a tree, if it be cut down, that it will sprout again, and that the tender branch thereof will not cease.

title: Job 14:8
text: Though the root thereof wax old in the earth, and the stock thereof die in the ground;

title: Job 14:9
text: Yet through the scent of water it will bud, and bring forth boughs like a plant.

title: Job 14:10
text: But man dieth, and wasteth away: yea, man giveth up the ghost, and where is he?

title: Job 14:11
text: As the waters fail from the sea, and the flood decayeth and drieth up:

title: Job 14:12
text: So man lieth down, and riseth not: till the heavens be no more, they shall not awake, nor be raised out of their sleep.

title: Job 14:13
text: O that thou wouldest hide me in the grave, that thou wouldest keep me secret, until thy wrath be past, that thou wouldest appoint me a set time, and remember me!

title: Job 14:14
text: If a man die, shall he live again?  all the days of my appointed time will I wait, till my change come.

title: Job 14:15
text: Thou shalt call, and I will answer thee: thou wilt have a desire to the work of thine hands.

title: Job 14:16
text: For now thou numberest my steps: dost thou not watch over my sin?

title: Job 14:17
text: My transgression is sealed up in a bag, and thou sewest up mine iniquity.

title: Job 14:18
text: And surely the mountain falling cometh to nought, and the rock is removed out of his place.

title: Job 14:19
text: The waters wear the stones: thou washest away the things which grow out of the dust of the earth; and thou destroyest the hope of man.

title: Job 14:20
text: Thou prevailest for ever against him, and he passeth: thou changest his countenance, and sendest him away.

title: Job 14:21
text: His sons come to honour, and he knoweth it not; and they are brought low, but he perceiveth it not of them.

title: Job 14:22
text: But his flesh upon him shall have pain, and his soul within him shall mourn.
